subject: Communication
title: What Is Conflict, Really?
description: A 60-second lesson on What Is Conflict, Really?.

hook.text: Two colleagues disagree on a deadline. Is it conflict? Two countries dispute a border. Is it the same thing?

buildup.text: Conflict is perceived incompatibility of goals, values, or needs between two or more parties.

discovery.text: The key word is 'perceived.' Many conflicts arise not from real incompatibility but from misunderstanding.

twist.text: Research shows 65% of workplace conflicts stem from miscommunication, not genuine disagreement.

climax.text: Understanding conflict means recognizing it's rarely about the issue stated. It's about unmet needs underneath.

punchline.text: Most conflicts aren't about what people say. They're about what they need.

quiz.question: What percentage of workplace conflicts stem from miscommunication?
